body: What window manager are you using?

unity. this started happening with the last updates in ubuntu repos yesterday, if i remember well there was some updates to the kernel, there was probably also some upates to Xorg but can't remember seeing them

rename.from: glfw apps don't start on ubuntu 14.10 with nvidia 331

body: [This](http://standards.freedesktop.org/wm-spec/wm-spec-1.4.html#idm139915845231248) describes the response GLFW is waiting for.
so it seems like a bug in unity right?
It may be. I'll go through my end again.
Even if it's a bug in Unity, if they're shipping with it GLFW will need to work around it.
yeah i guess. as i said this was working until yesterday it might be that if we report it they can fix it before the release.

ok, will try to open an issue, not sure how to phrase it though, what about?:

"according to http://standards.freedesktop.org/wm-spec/wm-spec-1.4.html#idm139915845231248 
A Client whose window has not yet been mapped can request of the Window Manager an estimate of the frame extents it will be given upon mapping. To retrieve such an estimate, the Client MUST send a _NET_REQUEST_FRAME_EXTENTS message to the root window.

when sending such message unity seems to never respond. this was working until last update"

https://bugs.launchpad.net/unity/+bug/1383429

it's been triaged today so probably will get fixed...

~~I think that would fix #344 as well.~~

EDIT: on second thought I didn't read well enough. I think #344 is caused by Unity (perhaps an older version) providing incorrect/invalid frame extents.

Hi, thanks for this test case... This happened as you didn't map the window before (and that's correct), compared to what java (the other toolkit I know it supports this atom) does.

Fix is on the way...
